author: senh
title: The Week in Pictures
text: BING NEWS: Lewistown residents worry about the fate of Dickson Mounds LEWISTOWN, Ill. -- People in and around Lewistown are worried the budget stalemate in Springfield will force state museums to close, which means Dickson Mounds could be on the chopping block. The Senate has approved funding to keep the museums open, but ... 08/4/2015 - 4:54 pm | View Link An unconventional entrance into the world for baby Paxton EAST PEORIA, Ill. -- It's a fear many mothers have before giving birth, what if I don't make it to the hospital? For one Eureka couple, that became reality. Paxton Smith is not even one month old and he's already famous in some ways -- all because he just ... 08/4/2015 - 4:54 pm | View Link People nationwide spread a message: Crime has to stop. PEORIA, Ill. -- Today is National Night Out Against Crime, and people took to the streets to stand up against crime in their neighborhoods. It's an event designed to promote safety, but also to stand against those who bring criminal activity into the area. 08/4/2015 - 4:54 pm | View Link Hanna City man is indicted in connection to the death of a friend. HANNA CITY, Ill. -- 21-year-old Dillon Nolan faces a slew of charges in connection with an April 16th incident that left 22-year-old Josh Fuller dead. Nolan told police that he flipped his truck near North McClellan and West Claybaugh Roads with Fuller in ... 08/4/2015 - 4:54 pm | View Link New details on the robbery of a Bradley student near campus PEORIA, Ill. -- New details in the police report on the robbery that happened early Saturday morning.
